example[0]: The book I wanted was at the very top of the pile.
example[1]: We could just see the white cliff tops in the distance.
example[2]: The tops of the mountains were still covered with snow.
example[3]: She could only just see over the tops of their heads.
example[4]: He was standing at the top of the stairs.
example[5]: We’ll sit down once we’re at the top.
example[6]: Write your name at the top of the page.
example[7]: Stop and wait for us when you get to the top of the slope.
example[8]: I filled the glass right to the top.
definition[1]: the flat upper surface of an object
example[9]: a low wooden table with a glass top
example[10]: Her fingers drummed on the table top.
example[11]: We walked along the top of the ancient city walls.
example[12]: She put the papers down on the top of the piano.
definition[2]: something that you put on or over an object to cover it, protect it, or prevent liquid coming out of it
example[13]: I can’t get the top off the jar.
example[14]: You’ve left the top off the toothpaste again!
example[15]: Can you put the top back on the bottle when you’ve finished with it?
example[16]: Has anyone seen my pen top?
definition[3]: a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body
example[17]: She was wearing a stripy knitted top.
example[18]: a skirt with a matching top
example[20]: I can’t find my pyjama top.
definition[4]: the part of a fruit or vegetable where it was attached to the plant, or the leaves of a plant whose root you can eat
example[21]: Cut the tops off the tomatoes.
example[22]: I’ve found a recipe for beetroot tops.
definition[5]: the part of the street or of a piece of land that is the furthest away from you
example[23]: I waited at the top of East Street.
definition[6]: a child’s toy that spins around on its point when you twist it
definition[7]: nearest to the top of something
example[24]: We have a flat on the top floor of the building.
example[25]: the top button of his shirt
example[26]: I managed to scrape off the top layer of paint.
example[27]: I found the letter in the top drawer of his desk.
example[30]: one of the world’s top engineering companies
definition[9]: winning in a game or competition
example[34]: Despite losing last night, Manchester United are still top  (=the highest in a list of clubs in a competition).
example[35]: Barcelona remain top of the league after beating Real Madrid.
definition[10]: to be higher than a particular amount
example[37]: Their profits have reportedly topped £1,000,000 this year.
definition[11]: to be in the highest position in a list because you are the most successful
example[38]: The Tower of London tops the list of London’s most popular tourist attractions.
example[39]: the team that has topped the Premiership for the last three seasons
example[40]: In 1998 the group topped the charts with the song ‘Don’t Stop Loving Me’.
definition[12]: if you top something, you do something that is better than it
example[41]: He topped his previous best performance, coming second in the 100 metres.
definition[13]: if you top a hill, you reach the top of it
example[42]: We topped the hill and looked down towards the valley below us.
example[43]: The top rate of income tax has been cut sharply.
example[45]: She spent five years in the top job.
example[46]: He is among the top 5% of earners in this country.
example[47]: the top 100 companies in the UK
example[49]: Profits this year should top £1.2 billion.
example[50]: Last year bilateral trade topped $1 billion.
definition[16]: to offer more money than someone else
example[51]: A rival company has topped our offer by $5 million.
definition[17]: the most important or most successful position in an organization, company, group etc
example[52]: He started life at the bottom and worked his way up to the top.
example[53]: This decision has come from the top (=was made by the most important managers).
